Title.evidence: A recent randomized phase III study of 719 de novo liver transplant recipients

Trial_Design.evidence: A recent randomized phase III study of 719 de novo liver transplant recipients

Participants.evidence: patients from North America (n = 211) had increased risk factors for posttransplant renal insufficiency

Intervention.evidence: early everolimus plus reduced-dose tacrolimus (EVR + rTAC) led to significantly better kidney function than standard TAC (TAC-C)

Method_Outcome.evidence: estimated glomerular filtration rates at randomization were higher in TAC-C over EVR + rTAC

Number_Randomised.evidence: A recent randomized phase III study of 719 de novo liver transplant recipients

Result_Outcome.evidence: Mean changes in estimated glomerular filtration rate values (mL/min per 1.73 m 2 ) favored EVR + rTAC over TAC-C at months 12 (+3.7 vs −4.5; P = 0.032), 24 (+2.7 vs −6.6; P = 0.042), and 36 (+4.3 vs −8.1; P = 0.059)
